{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks which of the following muscles of the larynx is NOT supplied by the recurrent laryngeal nerve. To answer this, we need to identify the muscles that are innervated by the recurrent laryngeal nerve. According to the documents, the recurrent laryngeal nerve innervates all intrinsic muscles of the larynx except for the cricothyroid muscle. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Cricothyroid, as it is the only muscle listed that is innervated by the external branch of the superior laryngeal nerve, not the recurrent laryngeal nerve.", "answer_choice": "B"}
